author: cbs8
title: New York Civil Rights Attorney Brett H. Klein Opens New Firm
text:
Klein Civil Rights
New York Civil Rights Attorney Brett H. Klein Opens New Firm Dedicated to Seeking Justice for Victims of Police Brutality
NEW YORK , Oct. 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Civil rights attorney Brett H. Klein, Esq. , has opened a new law firm in New York City to focus exclusively on cases of police brutality, unjust convictions and other civil rights violations involving police and corrections misconduct.
The firm, Brett H. Klein, Esq. , PLLC , is located at 305 Broadway in Manhattan and serves the entire New York Metro area, Long Island and upstate New York . Klein brings a strong background with years of experience in police cases, making him the New York area's top civil rights attorney.
The firm's new website, www.KleinCivilRights.com , provides details on the types of cases Mr. Klein specializes in, which include wrongful death, corrections misconduct, false arrest, malicious prosecution, unlawful strip searches, excessive force, stop and frisk, prisoners' rights, and prison rape.
Mr. Klein has extensive experience representing clients who have suffered traumatic brain injuries, orbital fractures, broken jaws, emotional distress and more at the hands of police and corrections officers. He also represents the families of people who have died in police custody or while incarcerated.
Mr. Klein is a member of the Eastern District of New York's Committee on Civil Litigation. He is also a member of the Federal Bar Council, the National Police Accountability Project, and the New York City Police Roundtable. Mr. Klein was co-founder and partner of a civil rights law firm in Brooklyn, New York , from 2004 to 2015.
Klein Civil Rights is located at 305 Broadway, Suite 600, in Manhattan , conveniently located to the City Hall/Brooklyn Bridge and Chambers Street subway stations. The firm's main phone number is (212) 335-0132.
